Pre-Game Insights: The USA team enters the series with a strong sense of assurance, having secured a commanding 4-0 victory against Canada in the previous month.
Captain Monank Patel played a pivotal role by scoring 120 runs in three innings, supported by notable performances from other players.
Bangladesh will arrive in the USA following a successful 4-1 series triumph over Zimbabwe, but will be without experienced fast bowler Taskin Ahmed due to injury.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Both teams boast a mix of seasoned players and exciting young talent, making this series a thrilling prelude to the World Cup.
The USA will aim to leverage their home advantage and continue their winning momentum, while Bangladesh will look to fine-tune their strategies and build confidence ahead of the global event.
Others: The series will serve as valuable preparation for the ICC Men's T20 World Cup, scheduled to be co-hosted by the West Indies Cricket Board (WICB) and USA Cricket in June.
Tickets for the series are available online, with general admission priced at $15 and party stands available for $40.
